files.name: README.md
files.content:
# Terraform - hello-node on ECS Fargate

This Terraform provisions:
- VPC (2 AZs) with public + private subnets
- Internet Gateway + NAT Gateways
- ECR repository
- ALB (HTTP; optional HTTPS with ACM + Route53)
- ECS Cluster/Service/Task Definition (Fargate)
- CloudWatch Log Group
- Optional GitHub Actions OIDC role

## Deploy

```bash
cd ai_tf
terraform init
terraform validate
terraform apply
```

## CI/CD notes

Your current workflow uses long-lived AWS keys and also uses an `--image` flag on `aws ecs update-service` (not supported by AWS CLI). Recommended approach:
- Push image to ECR
- Update task definition with new image tag and update the service to that new task definition, OR
- Keep task definition image tag as `latest` and force new deployment (less deterministic)

If you set `github_repo = "owner/repo"`, Terraform will create an OIDC role you can assume from GitHub Actions.
